availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Woods (Green County, Kentucky, Presbyterian minister)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, Presbyterian minister. Mercer County, Kentucky, native. Married Sarah C. Woods. Father of Waller Woods, William H. Woods, Joseph L. Woods, and Cortlandt B. Woods. Presbyterian clergyman in Green County in 1850, 1860, and 1863. Hired five enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 116. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, District 2, p. 88. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, District 2, p. 19. Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Green County, KY, September 1863, p. 209, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
